name: Supplemental Food For Seniors
description: The San Francisco-Marin Food Bank operates the Supplemental Food Program (SFP), which provides a monthly box of quality U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) food to low-income seniors. For dates and times of food distribution events, please visit online calendar for location nearest to you: Calendar
fullDescription: The San Francisco-Marin Food Bank operates the Supplemental Food Program (SFP), which provides a monthly box of quality U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) food to low-income seniors. For dates and times of food distribution events, please visit online calendar for location nearest to you: Calendar
whatTheyOffer: The San Francisco-Marin Food Bank operates the Supplemental Food Program (SFP), which provides a monthly box of quality U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) food to low-income seniors. For dates and times of food distribution events, please visit online calendar for location nearest to you: Calendar
howToGetIt: To participate in this program, you must be a senior at least 60 years of age who has income at or below 130% of the Federal Poverty Income Guidelines. Go to https://www.sfmfoodbank.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/SFP-Flyer-2023-1.pdf for more information and eligibility requirements.
